meanings.definition: The fully shaded inner region of a shadow cast by an opaque object.
meanings.sent1: The umbra of the tree's shadow was the darkest part.
meanings.sent2: She stood in the umbra of the building, shielded from the sun.
meanings.sent3: The cat chased after the umbra of a passing cloud.
meanings.sent4: His presence cast an umbra over the cheerful gathering.
meanings.sent5: The umbra of the mountain loomed ominously over the valley.

meanings.sent1: The haunted house was said to be visited by an umbra at midnight.
meanings.sent2: She felt a cold shiver as an umbra passed through the room.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled, pretending to be chased by an umbra.
meanings.sent4: The mist created an umbra that danced eerily in the moonlight.
meanings.sent5: The old legend spoke of an umbra that haunted the old graveyard.

meanings.sent1: They found a peaceful spot in the umbra of the park's trees.
meanings.sent2: The umbra of the umbrella provided relief from the scorching sun.
meanings.sent3: The cat napped lazily in the umbra of the garden shed.
meanings.sent4: The umbra of the cliff offered a cool respite from the heat.
meanings.sent5: She enjoyed reading in the umbra of her favorite tree.
